text: The movie just felt very different and not nearly as good as the first two. The story line was confusing and kind of all over the place. It was hard to track.
Love this movie love the series in general
I want 99 minutes of my life back
First of all, why would they change two characters in this boring ass movie like we wouldn’t notice. That threw me way off
right away i was all "Hardin needs to stop acting like a big baby about everything" - but the kid just can't catch a break.

"After We Fell" continues the captivating saga of Tessa and Hardin with heightened drama and emotional intensity. With strong performances and compelling character arcs, the film delivers an engaging and satisfying installment in the "After" series, leaving audiences eagerly anticipating the next chapter.
Don't listen to critter reviews and yes I know I wrote critter!!! They are so far off on this one. Make sure to start with after which is the first movie. You will not be disappointed!

After We Fell continues the After franchise by delivering new ways for our lovesick leads to fall apart. Though audiences have endured 2 full-length feature films, After We Fell remains consistent by mostly recycling old plot points. With some new 'surprises' popping up throughout, the After series is never short of convoluted drama at every turn.

While reconnecting with her father, troubled Tessa Young (Josephine Langford) foolishly falls back into her relationship with the emotionally unstable Hardin Scott (Hero Fiennes Tiffin). Now both dealing with daddy issues, the pair explore their past, while struggling with their future. Though every other character watches this embarrassing relationship progress, the leads inexplicitly cling to their toxic instability.

Shortly after watching this, I could not differentiate it from the past 2 installments and found myself struggling to remember which film had which arguments and which break-ups were caused by whose disloyalty/honesty. After We Fell holds a very rare honor by barely sticking with me and remaining indiscernible from the rest of the series. This truly belongs in the Sewers of Cinema.

This is the point in the movie where everything goes haywire, veering off a cliff into confusion, leaving you wondering what you're even watching.

Felt like a repetition without the depth of a storyline, filled with plot holes and rushed scenes that felt forced.

If you're going to commit to a franchise, then commit wholeheartedly. Unfortunately, this installment falls short, making it the weakest link in the trilogy.
My life is better now!!!!!
La reacción es muy radiactiva ☢ la trama es repetiva su pelean se perdonan y tiene sexo es muy aburrida es un 1.5 de 10
Please stop, no more.
Saw the other ones so I am peer pressured into watching the other ones that come out. How long will the story go for..

The worst movie of the trilogy. Honestly, the movie has no head or tail. This incomplete, many issues were addressed that were not relevant in the end. The film takes place between Tessa and Hardin's fight over their long-distance relationship. But, other topics like Tessa's father were not important, perhaps as an influence for Hardin to leave Alcohol. Other than that most of the movie is just sex and toxic fights. Tessa's condition never develops even in conversation with her partner. Hardin is a person with many problems, we know that from the previous parts, that's why the ending was surprising and dramatic, but it destroys everything addressed and built in the previous movie. As far as I understand it is the basis for the last movie which makes sense; But as a movie, it leaves a lot to be desired.

Mega apaixonadinha por essa franquia, já quero finalizar a última, continua fofo, saliente e caliente, draminha adolescente que encanta, briguinhas imaturas como todo adolescente  "deve" ser, mas até que fizeram um roteiro não muito enfadonho e embromado, aguardando ansiosa pelo quarto (será o último?) nos streaming… Perdi-me um pouco na reviravolta final, desnecessária, e forçadinha, só para ter um impacto, desproporcional e pareceu um arranjo de última hora, mas ainda apaixonada na franquia...
it was so good to see this beautiful movie I really love it
The movie was better than the previous but still horrible acting and horrible directing. The lead is the only redeemable quality of this series of films.

2 out of 5 stars. Third film in the series that has yet to develop the characters from the beginning of the first film. Which characters fail to grow and change. Hero Fiennes Tiffin still is the most annoying character with mood swings and whiny about everything. Josephine Langford is still flat with her character. No plot. No conflict besides Harin emotional about Tessa for doing her own thing or his family issues. The film is pointless and just giving or attempting steamy sex scenes and a story that goes nowhere again. Maybe the fourth film will break away from the terribleness.
Not as good as the last two parts but After we fell heralds a great ending.

Toxic relationship at its finest. The books were toxic, the story line for this movie is toxic. Hardins emotional maturity is that of a 12 year old. Pretty persistent thru all the  movies.  Hardin gives the illusion of being a grown up, then something where he has to actually feel something other than happy, he runs away like a whiney b*****.
